00022 using pi_generator::ScriptingBridge;

00024 // This is called by the brower when the 2D context has been flushed to the
00025 // browser window.
00026 void FlushCallback(NPP instance, NPDeviceContext* context,
00027                    NPError err, void* user_data) {
00028 }

00030 namespace pi_generator {
00031 
00032 PiGenerator::PiGenerator(NPP npp)
00033     : npp_(npp),
00034       scriptable_object_(NULL),
00035       window_(NULL),
00036       device2d_(NULL),
00037       quit_(false),
00038       thread_(0),
00039       pi_(0.0) {
00040   ScriptingBridge::InitializeIdentifiers();
00041 }
00042 
00043 PiGenerator::~PiGenerator() {
00044   quit_ = true;
00045   if (thread_) {
00046     pthread_join(thread_, NULL);
00047   }
00048   if (scriptable_object_) {
00049     NPN_ReleaseObject(scriptable_object_);
00050   }
00051   DestroyContext();
00052 }
00053 
00054 NPObject* PiGenerator::GetScriptableObject() {
00055   if (scriptable_object_ == NULL) {
00056     scriptable_object_ =
00057       NPN_CreateObject(npp_, &ScriptingBridge::np_class);
00058   }
00059   if (scriptable_object_) {
00060     NPN_RetainObject(scriptable_object_);
00061   }
00062   return scriptable_object_;
00063 }
00064 
00065 NPError PiGenerator::SetWindow(NPWindow* window) {
00066   if (!window)
00067     return NPERR_NO_ERROR;
00068   if (!IsContextValid())
00069     CreateContext();
00070   if (!IsContextValid())
00071     return NPERR_GENERIC_ERROR;
00072   // Clear the 2D drawing context.
00073   pthread_create(&thread_, NULL, pi, this);
00074   window_ = window;
00075   return Paint() ? NPERR_NO_ERROR : NPERR_GENERIC_ERROR;
00076 }
00077 
00078 bool PiGenerator::Paint() {
00079   if (IsContextValid()) {
00080     NPDeviceFlushContextCallbackPtr callback =
00081         reinterpret_cast<NPDeviceFlushContextCallbackPtr>(&FlushCallback);
00082     device2d_->flushContext(npp_, &context2d_, callback, NULL);
00083     return true;
00084   }
00085   return false;
00086 }
00087 
00088 void PiGenerator::CreateContext() {
00089   if (IsContextValid())
00090     return;
00091   device2d_ = NPN_AcquireDevice(npp_, NPPepper2DDevice);
00092   assert(IsContextValid());
00093   memset(&context2d_, 0, sizeof(context2d_));
00094   NPDeviceContext2DConfig config;
00095   NPError init_err = device2d_->initializeContext(npp_, &config, &context2d_);
00096   assert(NPERR_NO_ERROR == init_err);
00097 }
00098 
00099 void PiGenerator::DestroyContext() {
00100   if (!IsContextValid())
00101     return;
00102   device2d_->destroyContext(npp_, &context2d_);
00103 }
00104 
00105 // pi() estimates Pi using Monte Carlo method and it is executed by a separate
00106 // thread created in SetWindow(). pi() puts kMaxPointCount points inside the
00107 // square whose length of each side is 1.0, and calculates the ratio of the
00108 // number of points put inside the inscribed quadrant divided by the total
00109 // number of random points to get Pi/4.
00110 void* PiGenerator::pi(void* param) {
00111   const int kMaxPointCount = 1000000000;  // The total number of points to put.
00112   const uint32_t kOpaqueColorMask = 0xff000000;  // Opaque pixels.
00113   const uint32_t kRedMask = 0xff0000;
00114   const uint32_t kBlueMask = 0xff;
00115   const unsigned kRedShift = 16;
00116   const unsigned kBlueShift = 0;
00117   int count = 0;  // The number of points put inside the inscribed quadrant.
00118   unsigned int seed = 1;
00119   PiGenerator* pi_generator = static_cast<PiGenerator*>(param);
00120   uint32_t* pixel_bits = static_cast<uint32_t*>(pi_generator->pixels());
00121   srand(seed);
00122   for (int i = 1; i <= kMaxPointCount && !pi_generator->quit(); ++i) {
00123     double x = static_cast<double>(rand_r(&seed)) / RAND_MAX;
00124     double y = static_cast<double>(rand_r(&seed)) / RAND_MAX;
00125     double distance = sqrt(x * x + y * y);
00126     int px = x * pi_generator->width();
00127     int py = (1.0 - y) * pi_generator->height();
00128     uint32_t color = pixel_bits[pi_generator->width() * py + px];
00129     if (distance < 1.0) {
00130       // Set color to blue.
00131       ++count;
00132       pi_generator->pi_ = 4.0 * count / i;
00133       color += 4 << kBlueShift;
00134       color &= kBlueMask;
00135     } else {
00136       // Set color to red.
00137       color += 4 << kRedShift;
00138       color &= kRedMask;
00139     }
00140     pixel_bits[pi_generator->width() * py + px] = color | kOpaqueColorMask;
00141   }
00142   return 0;
00143 }
00144 
00145 }  // namespace pi_generator
